alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 9:05PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Very Strong Winds Behind Line of Storms... A line of storms is currently moving through eastern Iowa and into western Illinois. This line has a history of producing widespread damaging winds in excess of 70 to 80 mph, as it moves rapidly eastward at 55 to 65 mph. Behind this line, very strong gradient winds are currently being seen, gusting between 70 to 80 mph as well, not associated with the thunderstorms. These strong gradient winds will continue through a better part of the night. Be prepared for these prolonged winds and be sure to be in a safe place. If on the road, continue to travel with caution. Power outages are very possible, where many have already been seen.
